1.text: My son, if thou dost accept my sayings, And my commands dost lay up with thee,

2.text: To cause thine ear to attend to wisdom, Thou inclinest thy heart to understanding,

3.text: For, if for intelligence thou callest, For understanding givest forth thy voice,

4.text: If thou dost seek her as silver, And as hid treasures searchest for her,

5.text: Then understandest thou fear of Jehovah, And knowledge of God thou findest.

6.text: For Jehovah giveth wisdom, From His mouth knowledge and understanding.

7.text: Even to lay up for the upright substance, A shield for those walking uprightly.

8.text: To keep the paths of judgment, And the way of His saints He preserveth.

9.text: Then understandest thou righteousness, And judgment, and uprightnessâ€”every good path.

10.text: For wisdom cometh into thy heart, And knowledge to thy soul is pleasant,

11.text: Thoughtfulness doth watch over thee, Understanding doth keep thee,

12.text: To deliver thee from an evil way, From any speaking froward things,

13.text: Who are forsaking paths of uprightness, To walk in ways of darkness,

14.text: Who are rejoicing to do evil, They delight in frowardness of the wicked,

15.text: Whose paths are crooked, Yea, they are perverted in their ways.

16.text: To deliver thee from the strange woman, From the stranger who hath made smooth her sayings,

17.text: Who is forsaking the guide of her youth, And the covenant of her God hath forgotten.

18.text: For her house hath inclined unto death, And unto Rephaim her paths.

19.text: None going in unto her turn back, Nor do they reach the paths of life.

20.text: That thou dost go in the way of the good, And the paths of the righteous dost keep.

21.text: For the upright do inhabit the earth, And the perfect are left in it,

22.text: And the wicked from the earth are cut off, And treacherous dealers plucked out of it!
